intro: Psychotria taviunensis, commonly known as the Taviunensis Psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly in countries like Colombia and Ecuador. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white to pale pink flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments, often found in the understory of tropical rainforests. Psychotria taviunensis is also noted for its potential ethnobotanical uses, though research on its properties remains limited.
